name: src/API.js

properties.name: cancel
properties.description: ends the interaction. The result promise will not resolve.

properties.name: end
properties.description: ends the interaction properly. The result promise will resolve if possible.

properties.name: result
properties.description: a promise that represents the value of the interaction.

name: src/Attributions.js
src/configurators/ControlFactory.js
ControlsConfig
description:
Inside of this object the controls are configured. Normally they are referenced by their type, but if
 you have multiple controls of one type you can specify a name under which it is referenced. Then you
 have to specify the `controlType` in the configuration object.

 Example:
 let `'example'` be the chosen name for an attribution control. Then we can reference it in `onMap` or
 any `contains` property as `'example'`. The configuration object is now named `'example'` but needs to
 have an `'controlType'` property which needs to be set to `'attribution'`.

 ```
   "controls": {
     "onMap": ["example"],
     "example": {
       "controlType": "attribution",
       ...
     }
   }
 ```

properties.name: onMap
properties.description: All controls mentioned in this array will be added directly to the map.

name: ControlFactory
description:
A Factory that takes a control config as an object and returns the correspondig control. Modules can expand the
functionality of this class via the createControl method

name: createControl
description: The factory function

name: addControlTo
description: Function to add a control by its name to a certain receiver

name: addControlMultipleInternal_
description: Adds multiple controls to one receiver

name: addControls
description: Add all configured Controls to the map

name: setLocaliser
description: Sets the localiser to pass on to the controls

name: src/configurators/LayerConfigurator.js
LayerConfigurator
description: This is part of the MapConfigurator class

name: configureLayers
description:
configures the layers according to the layerConfig stored in the 'layerConfig' property stored in the map. If the
config changes this method is called automatically.

name: src/configurators/LayerFactory.js

types: {"CATEGORY": string, "SILENTGROUP": string, "GEOJSON": string, "KML": string, "WMS": string, "TILEWMS": string, "WMTS": string, "OSM": string, "STAMEN": string, "INTERN": string, "EMPTY": string, "XYZ": string, "BING": string}

name: g4uLayerOptions
description: Common config for all layers.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The layer type.

properties.name: id
properties.description: unique in the whole config

properties.name: available
properties.description: if set to false, the layer will not appear on the map or the layer selector.

properties.name: availableMobile
properties.description: overwrites available in mobile mode

properties.name: visible
properties.description: If set to `true` the layer will be visible on startup.

properties.name: alwaysVisible
properties.description: overwrites visible, available and mobileAvailable

name: SilentGroupLayerConfig
description: The silent group can display a group of layers which appears as a single in the layer selector.

name: CategoryLayerConfig
description: The category contains other layer(s) and will appear as a category in the layer selector.

name: EmptyLayerConfig
description: The empty layer will show nothing (in case of a base layer a white background).

name: XYZLayerConfig
description: A XYZ Layer (See http://openlayers.org/en/latest/apidoc/ol.source.XYZ.html).

name: OSMLayerConfig
description: An OSM Layer (See http://openlayers.org/en/latest/apidoc/ol.source.OSM.html).

name: StamenLayerConfig
description: A stamen Layer (See http://openlayers.org/en/latest/apidoc/ol.source.Stamen.html).

name: BingLayerConfig
description: A bing maps Layer (See http://openlayers.org/en/latest/apidoc/ol.source.BingMaps.html).

name: WMTSLayerConfig
description: A WMTS Layer. Check the {WMTSSSourceConfig}.

name: WMSLayerConfig
description: A WMS Layer. Check the {WMSSSourceConfig}.

name: TileWMSLayerConfig
description: A WMS Layer which is called like a tiled layer. Good for performance. Check the {WMSSSourceConfig}.

name: GeoJSONLayerConfig
description: A GeoJSON Layer.

name: KMLLayerConfig
description: A KML Layer.

name: InternalLayerConfig
description: A layer whichs contents are completly defined in the config file.

name: SourceConfig
description: A source config.

name: VectorSourceConfig
description: A vector source config.

properties.name: loadingStrategy
properties.description: "BBOX" or "ALL"

properties.name: bboxRatio
properties.description:
only applies if loadingStrategy is BBOX. If bigger than 1 this much more will be
   loaded around a bbox.

properties.name: localised
properties.description: if set to true the loader will send accept-language headers.

name: WMTSSSourceConfig
description:
A wmts source config. The config must contain a `config` object that must contain a `layer`` parameter. For other
   parameters see: http://openlayers.org/en/latest/apidoc/ol.source.WMTS.html#.optionsFromCapabilities. All other
   needed Parameters will be obtained automatically.

name: WMSSSourceConfig
description:
A wms source config. The config must contain a `params` object that must contain a `LAYERS` parameter. For other
   parameters see: http://openlayers.org/en/latest/apidoc/ol.source.ImageWMS.html -> Constructor options -> params.

name: InternalSourceConfig
description: An internal source whose features are defined directly in the config file.

name: LayerFactory
description: This class constructs a layer according to the given {{LayerOptions}}

name: addLayers
description: Adds multiple layers according to their configs to the given layerGroup

name: addLayer
description: Adds a layer defined by a given config to a given layerGroup

name: createLayer
description: Creates a layer or a collection of layers from the config

name: configureLayerIsIdOk_
description:
A function that checks if a layer id is setted and not a duplicate of another.
Throws an error if this is the case.

name: src/configurators/MapConfigurator.js

properties.name: proxy
properties.description:
A proxy url. It should have an {url} string which will be replaced with the proxied url.
   Example: 'proxy.php?csurl={url}'.

properties.name: userActionTracking
properties.description:
if checked the map tracks certain user actions and
   fires 'userActionTracking' events that contain this information. Tracked actions are: move, layer activation,
   clicks on features, printing, measurements.

properties.name: languageSettings
properties.description: settings regarding the display language.

properties.name: interfaceProjection
properties.description:
the projection the interface will use to interact with the
   user or the api.

properties.name: mapProjection
properties.description: the projection that is used internally. Will be infered from map data if not set.

properties.name: measurementProjection
properties.description: the projection measurements will calculated in.

properties.name: enableContextMenu
properties.description: enables the contextMenu outside of textinput fields

properties.name: view
properties.description: View options.

properties.name: scaleIcons
properties.description: a default scaling for all used feature icons

properties.name: hitTolerance
properties.description:
a default hit tolerance that will be used for all interactions
   (except show wms feature info).

properties.name: manageStyles
properties.description:
set this to false to disable style managing. This disables scaleIcons,
   mobileScaleIcons, feature hiding and adjustable style opacity

properties.name: mobileLayout
properties.description: special layout options for mobile use.

properties.name: additionalProjections
properties.description:
if any other projections than 'EPSG:4326' or 'EPSG:3857' are
   needed they can be specified here.

properties.name: api
properties.description: API-Options

properties.name: featurePopup
properties.description: Options regarding the feature popup.

properties.name: featureTooltip
properties.description: Options regarding the feature tooltip.

properties.name: showWMSFeatureInfo
properties.description: Options regarding WMS GetFeatureInfo.

properties.name: interactions
properties.description:
Specifies which map interactions should be turned on by default.
   Possible interactions are: 'doubleClickZoom', 'dragPan' (to which the {KineticOptions} are applied), 'dragRotate',
   'dragZoom', 'keyboardPan', 'keyboardZoom', 'mouseWheelZoom', 'pinchRotate', 'pinchZoom'

properties.name: kinetic
properties.description:
This influences the DragPan behaviour. If set to false no kinetic
   options are applied, if not set, the defaults are used.

properties.name: move
properties.description: Options regarding the behaviour of movements on the maps.

properties.name: positioning
properties.description: Options regarding the positioning of the controls.

properties.name: loadingStrategy
properties.description: Global default loading strategy. Can have the values 'BBOX' or 'ALL'.

properties.name: ignoreLayerAvailability
properties.description:
If set all layers are added to the map, regardless of their
   available config option.

properties.name: cssFile
properties.description: a cssFile to load and insert in the head dynamically.

properties.name: cssTemplate
properties.description:
if 3 colors are given, the colors used in the text of the loaded cssFile will be
   replaced by this colors. The colors in the cssFile need to be pure red, blue and green.

properties.name: styleMap
properties.description:
the style objects which will be mapped to certain identifiers. It
   is recommended that identifiers start with a #. The {{StyleObject}} with the identifier '#defaultStyle' will be
   used as a default Style in the whole Software.

properties.name: center
properties.description: the initial center of the map

properties.name: extent
properties.description: the max extent the center can lay in

properties.name: fit
properties.description: an extent to fit the map initialy to, overwrites center settings

properties.name: mediaQueries
properties.description:
these will enable the mobile layout including removing the g4u-desktop class from
   the ol-viewport and adding the g4u-mobile class

properties.name: scaleIcons
properties.description: a value to scale all icons by

properties.name: animations
properties.description: if animations should be disabled

name: MapConfigurator
description:
This class configures a map once the configureMap method is called.
configureMap initializes the map and can only be called once.
it delegates the configureUI and configureLayers to the {{UIConfigurator}} and {{LayerConfigurator}} classes.

name: configureLayers
description: Delegate call to {{LayerConfigurator}}

name: configureUI
description: Delegate call to {{UIConfigurator}}

name: src/configurators/Positioning.js
Float
description:
This describes the floating directions of an element. It can be an array, then it will move from the center to the
first specified direction and after that it moves in the second direction. If it is set to 'fixed' it is not
positioned via Positioning.

properties.name: float
properties.description: first and second direction or special value 'fixed'

properties.name: float
properties.description: first and second direction or special value 'fixed'

ActiveGroup

This class organizes controls in an active group in which only one control can bea active at a time.
This specified and configured via a property 'activeGroup' in the config object of the control and
a matching string for all controls which should be in this group

properties.name: labels
properties.description: unicode labels for the buttons (only shown if pictures are not loaded)

name: ArrowButtons
description:
ArrowButtons shows Buttons on the map which let you move in all 4 directions and a button to return to the initial
position of the map. It provides an Interface class with an produceOlControl returning an
{ol.control.Control} - Object. This can be added as normal controls to the map
(e.g. ``map.addControl(arrowButtons.produceOlControl)`` ).

The Options are passed as an Object (e.g. ``{ initCenter : map.getView().getCenter(),
     initZoom : map.getView().getZoom() }``.

types: {left: number[], up: number[], right: number[], down: number[]}
{up: string, right: string, down: string, left: string, center: string}

name: onClick_
description: This method is called when a button is clicked and makes a move on the map corresponding to the direction.

if wrap is set to true a span will be put arround the element
   if set to false the element of the control will be inserted directly

if this is set to true the wrap or the element will get css classes
   indicating its position inside the container

params.name: options.element

if this is set it will be put inside the container instead calling
   control.set$Target()

name: src/controls/Control.js
content:
import ol from 'openlayers'
import { mixin } from '../utilities'
import {ControlLogicMixin} from './ControlLogicMixin'

/**
 * @typedef {object} g4uControlOptions
 * @property {string} [controlType] the type of the control. If not given the name of the control is used
 * @property {number} [importance] how important the control is on the map. the higher this value is, the longer it
 *    will be kept on the map if the viewport gets smaller.
 * @property {string} [activeGroup] if controls are in the same active group only one of them can be active at the same
 *    time
 * @property {string} [className]
 * @property {HTMLElement} element
 * @property {L10N} localiser the localiser to use by the control.
 * @property {string} controlName the name of the control.
 * @property {boolean} [singleButton=false] if the control only consists of one button
 * @property {String|HTMLElement|jQuery} [target]
 * @property {Localizable} [title] not used by every control
 * @property {Localizable} [tipLabel] not used by every control
 * @property {Float} [float]
 * @property {boolean} [windowed=false] whether the control resides inside a window or not
 */

/**
 * This is a customized ol.control.Control class, all logic is in the ol.control.ControlLogic
 * @class Control
 * @extends {ControlLogicMixin}
 * @extends {ol.control.Control}
 */

export const Control = mixin(ol.control.Control, ControlLogicMixin)

properties.name: controlType
properties.description: the type of the control. If not given the name of the control is used

properties.name: importance
properties.description:
how important the control is on the map. the higher this value is, the longer it
   will be kept on the map if the viewport gets smaller.

properties.name: activeGroup
properties.description:
if controls are in the same active group only one of them can be active at the same
   time

properties.name: localiser
properties.description: the localiser to use by the control.

properties.name: controlName
properties.description: the name of the control.

properties.name: singleButton
properties.description: if the control only consists of one button

properties.name: title
properties.description: not used by every control

properties.name: tipLabel
properties.description: not used by every control

properties.name: windowed
properties.description: whether the control resides inside a window or not

name: Control
description: This is a customized ol.control.Control class, all logic is in the ol.control.ControlLogic

name: src/controls/ControlLogicMixin.js
ControlLogicMixin
description:
This class contains logic which should be part of any Control in the Software. Any custom controls
should inherit from Control which inherits from this class AND from ol.cont

name: isSingleButton
description: Returns true if the element consists only of a single button

name: getTitle
description: Returns the title of the control if given to the constructor

name: getTipLabel
description: Returns the tipLabel of the control if given to the constructor

name: get$Element
description: Returns the element of the control

name: get$Target
description: Returns the target of the control

name: getClassName
description: Returns the CSS-className of the control

name: set$Target
description: Sets a new target for the control

params.name: $target
params.description: element it is moved to

This control shows Buttons to let you select the layer you want to see on the map.
It supports categories and nested categories - each {GroupLayer}-Object will be interpreted as a category.

description: Returns true if the control is squeezable in the given dimension. Used by Positioning.

description:
Squeezes the control in the given dimension by the provided value. Used by Positioning
Returns the value the control could get squeezed by.

name: afterPositioning
description: used by positioning

name: release
description: Removes the squeeze. Used by Positioning.

If the child control has a setActive method it is called upon opening and closing the window.

content:
// copied from openlayers source (src/ol/events.js)

export const olEventTypes = {
  CHANGE: 'change',
  CLICK: 'click',
  DBLCLICK: 'dblclick',
  DRAGENTER: 'dragenter',
  DRAGOVER: 'dragover',
  DROP: 'drop',
  ERROR: 'error',
  KEYDOWN: 'keydown',
  KEYPRESS: 'keypress',
  LOAD: 'load',
  MOUSEDOWN: 'mousedown',
  MOUSEMOVE: 'mousemove',
  MOUSEOUT: 'mouseout',
  MOUSEUP: 'mouseup',
  MOUSEWHEEL: 'mousewheel',
  MSPOINTERDOWN: 'mspointerdown',
  RESIZE: 'resize',
  TOUCHSTART: 'touchstart',
  TOUCHMOVE: 'touchmove',
  TOUCHEND: 'touchend',
  WHEEL: 'wheel'
}

types: {"CHANGE": string, "CLICK": string, "DBLCLICK": string, "DRAGENTER": string, "DRAGOVER": string, "DROP": string, "ERROR": string, "KEYDOWN": string, "KEYPRESS": string, "LOAD": string, "MOUSEDOWN": string, "MOUSEMOVE": string, "MOUSEOUT": string, "MOUSEUP": string, "MOUSEWHEEL": string, "MSPOINTERDOWN": string, "RESIZE": string, "TOUCHSTART": string, "TOUCHMOVE": string, "TOUCHEND": string, "WHEEL": string}

description: Update the Popup. Call this if something in the feature has changed

description: The feature should have a property 'name' and/or 'description' to be shown inside of the popup.

description: calculates iconSized Offset and applies it

calculates Center of the Popup. Be careful, this calculation repositions the popup to calculate the center
properly and repostions to the initial Position again.
This does only work if the popup is already visible!

FeatureTooltip

name: src/G4UMap.js
G4UMap
description:
Definition of the map-object
Main task of the constructor is to load and read out the configuration.
Uses the functions makeMapLayers, makeMapUI to create the map.

Custom properties accessible via method .get('propertyName')

params.name: target
params.description: element or id of an element

name: getControlsByName
description: Searches all controls of the specified name

name: afterPostrender
description: The listener is called once immediately after the next postrender event

name: removeInteractions
description: Remove all interactions

name: addInteraction
description: overwrite base method to notify developer about differing api

name: addDefaultInteraction
description: Add an interaction that should be active by default (i.e. in the normal state of the map)

params.name: eventTypes
params.description: a list of space separated eventtypes this interaction reacts on

name: deactivateInteractions
description: This deactivates all interactions which use a given event type

name: activateInteractions
description: Reactivates all default interactions which use a specified event type

name: getDefaultInteractions
description: Gets all interactions which use the specified event type

name: addSupersedingInteraction
description:
This adds an interaction to the map which prohibits other interactions which use the same eventtype to be active
at the same time. When the superseding interaction is activated all affected ones get deactivated and vice versa

params.name: eventTypes
params.description: a list of space separated eventtypes this interaction reacts on

params.name: silent
params.description: provide map to layers

name: removeControls
description: Remove all controls

name: src/globals.js
content:
/**
 * Globals
 */

/**
 * Descriptive identifiers for some keyCodes
 * @type {object.<string, number>}
 */
export const keyCodes = {
  ESCAPE: 27,
  TAB: 9,
  ARROW_DOWN: 40,
  ARROW_UP: 38,
  ENTER: 13,
  SHIFT: 16,
  CTRL: 17
}

/**
 * Names of globally used cssClasses are stored here
 * @type {object.<string, string>}
 */
export const cssClasses = {
  mousedown: 'g4u-mouse-down',
  clickable: 'g4u-clickable',
  crosshair: 'g4u-crosshair',
  hidden: 'g4u-hidden',
  arrow: 'g4u-arrow',
  mobile: 'g4u-mobile',
  desktop: 'g4u-desktop',
  move: 'g4u-move',
  active: 'g4u-active',
  mainButton: 'g4u-control-mainbutton',
  hasTooltip: 'g4u-has-tooltip',
  upperCase: 'g4u-uppercase',
  collapsed: 'g4u-collapsed'
}

name: keyCodes
description: Descriptive identifiers for some keyCodes

name: cssClasses
description: Names of globally used cssClasses are stored here

name: src/html/ButtonBox.js

properties.name: content
properties.description: the content of the body of the button box

properties.name: titleButton
properties.description: displays an extra button with a title firing an 'title:click' event

properties.name: title
properties.description: the title appearing on the button

name: ButtonBox
description:
An Element to easily construct nested HTML Menus
It contains of a button followed by a body below the button. The button can toggle the visibility of the body.
If multiple elements with the same classname are nested it gives the last visible element a special class name.
It can also marks one or multiple element in the tree to be active (same classname is needed, too).
After a ButtonBox has been added all child elements the method finish should be called.

name: lastVisibleClass_
description: distribute the last visible class to the correct element

name: get$Body
description: Returns the body element

name: get$Element
description: Returns the element itself

name: get$LastChild_
description: finds and returns the last child in the body of the given element if it is of the same classname as this ButtonBox

name: giveLastVisible
description: Gives the last element in the element the last visible class

name: takeLastVisible
description:
Searches for the last visible class in its child elements and removes it.
Returns true if it was removed.

name: finish
description: This method should be called after all child elements have been added to the button box

name: src/html/Dropdown.js

properties.name: ghostentry
properties.description: This text is shown if the dropdown has no entries

properties.name: slideDuration
properties.description: standard slideDuration

name: Dropdown
description:
A HTML Dropdown select.
The text entries in the list can be setted and changed and given a click handler.

unknown.tagValue: 'leave:backwards' This event is raised if the dropdown is left via the up arrow or shift+tab
'leave:forwards' This event is raised if the dropdown is left via the down arrow or tab

name: getValue
description: returns the value of the selected list element

name: getText
description: returns the text of the current selected list element

name: get$Element
description: return the whole element

name: getLength
description: Returns the amount of dropdown entries

name: addEntry
description: Adds an entry to the end of the dropdown list

name: setEntries
description:
This function takes an array of entries (strings).
The length of the dropdown is set to the length of the arrays (they have to have the same length).

name: setLength
description:
This function corrects the number of entries in the dropdown. The content of the entries is not respected.
New entries are slided down, to be removed entries are slided up then removed.

params.name: immediately
params.description: if setted to true the animation is skipped

params.name: immediately
params.description: if setted to true the animation is skipped

name: clear
description: Removes all entries

name: isSelectable
description: Returns true if the dropdown has selectable elements

name: src/html/History.js
src/html/html.js
getInFront
description: This function gets an $element inside a $context in fornt of all of them

name: src/html/Shield.js
Shield
description:
A shield that sets itself in front of all other elements in a context if activated, hides itself if deactivated.
It can get another element in front of it (Attention: it gets removed from its context temporarly)

name: add$OnTop
description: Gets the given element in front of the shield. The element is removed from its context temporarily

name: remove$OnTop
description: Returns the given element in front of the shield to the previous context

name: get$ElementsInFront
description: Returns all children in front of the shield

name: src/html/Window.js

properties.name: id
properties.description: an html id for the outer window element

properties.name: className
properties.description: an alternative html class name to use instead of 'g4u-window', not recommended

properties.name: map
properties.description: the map the window should be shown on. The viewport will be set as the context of the window

properties.name: $context
properties.description: context the window is shown in

properties.name: visible
properties.description: the visibility of the window on start up

properties.name: fixedPosition
properties.description: if the window is movable or not

name: Window
description: A HTML Window

name: makeWindowDraggable_
description: Makes the Window draggable

name: setEnableMobileScrolling_
description: Enables/Disables the scroll lib needed for mobile scrolling

name: getInFront
description: Moves the window in front of all other elements inside its context

name: updateSize
description:
Fixes width and height depending on the current content on the popup.
needs to be called when the window is visible.

name: src/interactions/FeatureSelect.js
FeatureSelect
description:
This interaction is a little further customized select interaction.
Selected features get sorted by geometry type.

name: src/interactions/MapEventInteraction.js
src/L10N.js
L10N
description:
This class localizes texts by either selecting one from a dictionary (asynchron loaded JSON File) or choosing the
right string from a selection.

name: ajaxGetLanguageFile
description: Loads the language file. This function is called manually from outside to be abel to pass in a callback.

name: selectL10N
description:
Select language string. Note that this routine throws an error if there is no fitting string. Method to obtain the
   fitting string:
1. If there is no data, an 'Unable to obtain localization' error is thrown.
2. If data is a string, that string is returned.
3. If language is given and present in data, the string value for langage is returned.
4. If the default language is given and present in data, that value is returned.
5. If the special tag '*' is present in data, that value is returned.
6. If still no string was found at this point, an 'Unable to obtain localization' error is thrown.

name: localiseUsingDictionary
description:
Localise identifier using given dictionary. Throws an error if identifier is not in dictionary. Relies on
selectL10N to select actual localisation.

params.name: silent
params.description: if an error message should be printed if the text is not found in the dictionary

name: src/layers/BaseTileLayer.js

import {TileLayer} from './TileLayer'
import {BaseLayerMixin} from './BaseLayerMixin'
import { mixin } from '../utilities'

export const BaseTileLayer = mixin(TileLayer, BaseLayerMixin)

name: src/layers/EmptyBaseLayer.js
src/layers/GroupLayer.js
GroupLayer
description:
This Class is a Wrap around {ol.layer.Group} providing some extra functionality. This class is normally used for a
category of layers containing them.

name: provideMap
description: The provideMap methods of all contained children are called recursively

name: recursiveForEach
description: calls callback for every terminal, non-group Layer

name: forEachOn
description:
Attachs a listener to each layer and to each newly added listener and removes the listener if the layer gets
removed.

name: countChildrenVisible
description: Checks how many children are visible. Doesn't check visibility of the group layer

name: getLayersArray
description: Returns the layers inside as an array.

name: getLength
description: Returns the number of direct child layers

name: isParentOf
description: checks if the given layer is a child of the grouplayer

name: getIds
description: Returns all ids of all contained layers and its own.

name: getAttributions
description: Returns all attributions of all visible layers.

name: removeLayerById
description: Remove layer by id

name: findLayer
description: Find layer with callback

name: getLayerById
description: Get layer by id

name: removeLayer
description: removes layer

name: getIdsVisibilities
description: gives an object with ids as keys and visibility as value

name: setIdsVisibilities
description: Sets the visibility of the layers to the given visibility

name: containsLayer
description: Checks if the group contains the layer

name: src/layers/ImageLayer.js
content:
import ol from 'openlayers'

import {LayerLoadProcessCountMixin} from './LayerLoadProcessCountMixin'
import {BaseLayerMixin} from './BaseLayerMixin'
import { mixin } from '../utilities'
import {ProvideMapMixin} from './ProvideMapMixin'

export const ImageLayer = mixin(ol.layer.Image, [ ProvideMapMixin, LayerLoadProcessCountMixin ])

export const BaseLayerImage = mixin(ImageLayer, BaseLayerMixin)

name: src/layers/TileLayer.js
content:
import ol from 'openlayers'

import {LayerLoadProcessCountMixin} from './LayerLoadProcessCountMixin'
import { mixin } from '../utilities'
import {ProvideMapMixin} from './ProvideMapMixin'

export const TileLayer = mixin(ol.layer.Tile, [ ProvideMapMixin, LayerLoadProcessCountMixin ])

properties.name: loadingStrategy
properties.description:
Either 'BBOX' or 'ALL' (Synonym: 'FIXED').
   If BBOX the given url has to contain the parameters {bboxleft}, {bboxbottom}, {bboxright}, {bboxtop}.

properties.name: bboxRatio
properties.description: If set the bbox loading strategy will increase the load extent by this factor

coordinates will be inserted into the url in this format. defaults to
   the interfaceProjection

properties.description: true, false for dataType 'script' and 'jsonp'

properties.name: refresh
properties.description: if set the layer will refresh itself in the specified time (in ms)

name: SourceServerVector
description:
A custom Source class handling Vector Sources.

Let you set the loading loadingStrategy, if a proxy is used and you should specify in which format it comes in.

**IMPORTANT:** You can't set the projection of the source! This is **always** determined by the data received. If you
set projection here you force the source to assume that this is the projection of the view.

This class defines a custom loader function which makes it possible to use different loading strategies.

name: doClear_
description: indicates if the source needs to be emptied

name: loader
description: This method returns a promise which is triggered after the loader successfully loaded a source.

name: setRefresh
description: This sets the refresh rate. A value of 0 or smaller turns refresh off.

name: addProxyToHrefTags
description:
makes all urls in href-tags inside of a xmlDocument use the proxy address.
this function needs to extended with all Tags which could contain urls

params.name: text
params.description: an xml-Document

name: mixin
description:
This creates a new class which inherits from the base class and mixes in every method (except any method named
'initialize') from the mixin class. The mixin class may not overwrite any existing method. If it has a method called
'initialize' this will be remembered and called after the constructor of the base class has finished

description: This returns a mixin as a normal class.

name: mergeWithDefaults
description:
basically adds all properties (key, value - pairs) from defaults to config whichs keys aren't keys of config.
     (except for keys with 'Element' in their name)
if the value is an object (on the left side, config) it is called recursively
if the value is an array (on the left side, config) it is called with the key value+'Element' for each element
     of the array

params.name: config
params.description: the config which should be mergeed with defaults

params.name: defaults
params.description: the defaults to be merged with config

name: take
description: Removes a property from an object and returns its value

content: # ![Guide4You](https://github.com/KlausBenndorf/guide4you/raw/master/images/g4u-logo.png) guide4you [![Greenkeeper badge](https://badges.greenkeeper.io/KlausBenndorf/guide4you.svg)](https://greenkeeper.io/) [![NPM](https://nodei.co/npm/guide4you.png?mini=true)](https://npmjs.org/package/guide4you) [![JavaScript Style Guide](https://img.shields.io/badge/code%20style-standard-brightgreen.svg)](http://standardjs.com/) [![Continuous Integration](https://travis-ci.org/KlausBenndorf/guide4you.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/KlausBenndorf/guide4you) [![Documentation Coverage](http://klausbenndorf.github.io/guide4you/badge.svg)](http://klausbenndorf.github.io/guide4you/index.html) **GUIDE4YOU** is a JavaScript Web client application built on [OpenLayers](http://openlayers.org) that supports both desktop and mobile web browsers and features a responsive design. ![Screenshot of desktop view, 736x467 pixel](https://github.com/KlausBenndorf/guide4you/raw/master/images/screenshots/desktop-736-467.png "Screenshot of desktop view, 736x467 pixel") For a screenshot of the mobile view [see below](#mobile-screenshot). ## What can GUIDE4YOU do for you? With the basic system **GUIDE4YOU** can: * Display maps like [Openstreetmap](https://openstreetmap.org), [OpenTopoMap](https://opentopomap.org), or [OpenCycleMap](http://www.thunderforest.com/maps/opencyclemap/) * Use OSM, WMS, WFS, KML, GPX (others follow) * Measure areas and distances * Display your location * Print the current view on a single page * Overlay a base map with points of interest and the like * Configure a set of base maps and overlays to choose from * Allow for different languages * … With additional modules it can also: * [URLAPI module](https://github.com/KlausBenndorf/guide4you-module-urlapi): Generate links so you can share a certain view of a map. That view can include a location marker and a description of the location in question. * [Search module](https://github.com/KlausBenndorf/guide4you-module-search): Search for locations using [Nominatim](https://nominatim.openstreetmap.org/). Alternatively you can customize this module to use other engines. * Edit GPX data (coming soon) * … ## Why use GUIDE4YOU? Compared to alternative software **GUIDE4YOU** provides a couple of interesting features: * Highly customizable * Support for new languages can easily be added. English, german, polish and arabic are supported out of the box. * Icons are vector graphics (SVG) so they can be scaled to whatever size seems suitable * No separate mobile and desktop versions * Easily extensible ## Which browsers are supported? All modern browsers including * Firefox * Chrome * Edge and Internet Explorer 10+ * Safari ## How to setup? Install guide4you from npm or clone the repository ``` npm install guide4you ``` or ``` git clone https://github.com/KlausBenndorf/guide4you.git ``` To find out what is needed insede a webpage to include GUIDE4YOU check out the index.html in the dist folder. It contains everything which is needed to get you started. The crucial part is: ``` g4u.createMap('#g4u-map') ``` This method creates the map in the given DOM-Element. It accepts a selector or a reference to a DOM-Element. As a second and third argument it accepts a [https://klausbenndorf.github.io/guide4you/typedef/index.html#static-typedef-MapConfig](map configuration) and a [https://klausbenndorf.github.io/guide4you/typedef/index.html#static-typedef-LayerConfig](layer configuration). Both can be provided as paths to JSON-files or as actual JavaScript objects. ## How to build a customized version of GUIDE4YOU? Switch into the `guide4you` directory and install all dependecies using ``` npm install ``` Then build with a configuration of your choice ``` npm run build conf/simple ``` If you want to develop you can use the dev server script, which listens on port 8080 by default ``` npm run dev conf/simple ``` ## Documentation A german documentation can be found here: [GUIDE4YOU Benutzerhandbuch](https://github.com/KlausBenndorf/guide4you/wiki/GUIDE4YOU-Benutzerhandbuch) An API-Documentation can be found here: [https://klausbenndorf.github.io/guide4you/index.html](https://klausbenndorf.github.io/guide4you/index.html). ## Support Please feel free to ask any question on [Stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com) with the guide4you tag and file any bugs in the [issue tracker](https://github.com/KlausBenndorf/guide4you/issues). ## Mobile Screenshot ![Screenshot of mobile view, 360x640 pixel](https://github.com/KlausBenndorf/guide4you/raw/master/images/screenshots/mobile-360-640.png "Screenshot of mobile view, 360x640 pixel")
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "guide4you",
  "version": "2.9.0",
  "description": "A configurable web client for geo-applications. Uses OpenLayers. Suitable for mobile devices.",
  "keywords": [
    "map",
    "map client",
    "openlayers"
  ],
  "author": "Klaus Benndorf",
  "homepage": "https://github.com/KlausBenndorf/guide4you",
  "license": "MIT",
  "contributors": [
    "Sascha Klemenjak <sascha.klemenjak@benndorf.de>",
    "Josef Schugt <josef.schugt@benndorf.de>",
    "Simon Seyock <simonseyock@gmail.com>"
  ],
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "https://github.com/KlausBenndorf/guide4you"
  },
  "peerDependencies": {
    "jquery": "3.2.1",
    "openlayers": "github:KlausBenndorf/ol3#g4u3_v4.3.1"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "better-scroll": "^1.4.2",
    "csscolorparser": "1.0.3",
    "lodash": "4.17.4",
    "notifyjs-browser": "0.4.2",
    "proj4": "^2.4.3",
    "strip-json-comments": "2.0.1"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel-polyfill": "^6.26.0",
    "concurrently": "^3.4.0",
    "esdoc": "^1.0.3",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "guide4you-builder": "2.2.2",
    "guide4you-proxy": "github:KlausBenndorf/guide4you-proxy#v1.1.0",
    "http-server": "^0.10.0",
    "jquery": "3.2.1",
    "mocha": "4.0.1",
    "openlayers": "github:KlausBenndorf/ol3#g4u3_v4.3.1",
    "phantomjs-prebuilt": "2.1.14",
    "selenium-webdriver": "3.6.0",
    "standard": "10.0.3",
    "wait-on": "^2.0.2"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "dist": "g4u-build -m dist -c conf/dist",
    "build": "g4u-build -m prod -c",
    "debugBuild": "g4u-build -d -m prod -c",
    "dev": "g4u-build -m dev -c",
    "lint": "eslint src/ tests/",
    "version": "(npm run test && npm run doc && git add -A) || git checkout .",
    "buildTests": "concurrently \"g4u-buildTests\" \"npm run dist\"",
    "runTests": " concurrently --kill-others --success first \"http-server ./ -p 8089 -s\" \"wait-on -l http-get://localhost:8089 && mocha build/tests/*\"",
    "test": "npm run lint && npm run buildTests && npm run runTests && echo \"Tests completed successfully\"",
    "doc": "esdoc -c esdoc.json",
    "typing": "jsdoc -t node_modules/tsd-jsdoc -r conf/dist/entry.js src/ -d dist/"
  },
  "main": "./dist/g4u.js",
  "module": "./config/dist/entry.js",
  "types": "./dist/g4u.d.ts"
}
name: package.json
